trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: One of the key benefits of using Chrome App notifications is that the notifications show up within the context of the Google Chrome browser.
trans-unit.target: One of the key benefits of using Chrome App notifications is that the notifications show up within the context of the Google Chrome browser.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to have the Chrome App running or open in the browser (though the Chrome browser itself must be running).
trans-unit.target: You don't need to have the Chrome App running or open in the browser (though the Chrome browser itself must be running).

trans-unit.source: You also get a consolidated view of all your notifications in the Chrome Notifications window.
trans-unit.target: You also get a consolidated view of all your notifications in the Chrome Notifications window.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This is not a generic in-browser push notification and is specific to Chrome Apps—see [Chrome Apps Overview] for details.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This is not a generic in-browser push notification and is specific to Chrome Apps—see [Chrome Apps Overview] for details.

trans-unit.source: Chrome Apps were previously known as "Packaged Apps" and are different from simpler "Hosted Apps".
trans-unit.target: Chrome Apps were previously known as "Packaged Apps" and are different from simpler "Hosted Apps".

trans-unit.source: See [Installable Web Apps] for the difference.
trans-unit.target: See [Installable Web Apps] for the difference.

trans-unit.source: Chrome Apps can also run on mobile (Android and iOS) via Apache Cordova.
trans-unit.target: Chrome Apps can also run on mobile (Android and iOS) via Apache Cordova.

trans-unit.source: See [Chrome Apps on Mobile] to learn more.
trans-unit.target: See [Chrome Apps on Mobile] to learn more.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will create a Chrome app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will create a Chrome app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).

trans-unit.source: When you complete the tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the Chrome users who have installed this Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: When you complete the tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the Chrome users who have installed this Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:
trans-unit.target: The tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: Connect your Chrome App to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connect your Chrome App to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: Send a notification to your Chrome App
trans-unit.target: Send a notification to your Chrome App

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Configuring GCM and Azure Notification Hubs is identical to configuring for Android, since [Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome] has been deprecated and the same GCM now supports both Android devices and Chrome instances.
trans-unit.target: Configuring GCM and Azure Notification Hubs is identical to configuring for Android, since [Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome] has been deprecated and the same GCM now supports both Android devices and Chrome instances.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the tutorials in the "Next steps" section to see how to use notification hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the tutorials in the "Next steps" section to see how to use notification hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%notification-hubs-chrome-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%notification-hubs-chrome-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [Google Cloud Console] website, sign in with your Google account credentials, and then click the **Create Project** button.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [Google Cloud Console] website, sign in with your Google account credentials, and then click the **Create Project** button.

trans-unit.source: Provide an appropriate **Project Name**, and then click the **Create** button.
trans-unit.target: Provide an appropriate **Project Name**, and then click the **Create** button.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the **Project Number** on the **Projects** page for the project that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the **Project Number** on the **Projects** page for the project that you just created.

trans-unit.source: You will use this as the **GCM Sender ID** in the Chrome App to register with GCM.
trans-unit.target: You will use this as the **GCM Sender ID** in the Chrome App to register with GCM.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click **APIs & auth**, and then scroll down and click the toggle to enable **Google Cloud Messaging for Android**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click **APIs & auth**, and then scroll down and click the toggle to enable **Google Cloud Messaging for Android**.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to enable **Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome**.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to enable **Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click **Credentials** > **Create New Key** > **Server Key** > **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click **Credentials** > **Create New Key** > **Server Key** > **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the server **API Key**.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the server **API Key**.

trans-unit.source: You will configure this in your notification hub next, to enable it to send push notifications to GCM.
trans-unit.target: You will configure this in your notification hub next, to enable it to send push notifications to GCM.

trans-unit.source: Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click **+ NEW** at the bottom left of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click **+ NEW** at the bottom left of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services** > **Service Bus** > **Notification Hub** > **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services** > **Service Bus** > **Notification Hub** > **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a new Notification Hub**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a new Notification Hub**.

trans-unit.source: Go to the notification hub that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Go to the notification hub that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace that houses your notification hub (usually ***notification hub name*-ns**).
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace that houses your notification hub (usually ***notification hub name*-ns**).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Notification Hubs** tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Notification Hubs** tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Configure** tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Configure** tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure** tab, scroll down to the **google cloud messaging settings**, enter the **API Key** value that you obtained in the previous section, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure** tab, scroll down to the **google cloud messaging settings**, enter the **API Key** value that you obtained in the previous section, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Dashboard** tab at the top, and then click **Connection Information** at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Dashboard** tab at the top, and then click **Connection Information** at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: Take note of **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** (which you will need on the Chrome App to register with the notification hub) and **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** (which you will need to send notifications).
trans-unit.target: Take note of **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** (which you will need on the Chrome App to register with the notification hub) and **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** (which you will need to send notifications).

trans-unit.source: Your notification hub is now configured to work with GCM, and you have the required connection strings for further configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your notification hub is now configured to work with GCM, and you have the required connection strings for further configuration.

trans-unit.source: Connect your Chrome App to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connect your Chrome App to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: Create a new Chrome App
trans-unit.target: Create a new Chrome App

trans-unit.source: The sample below is based on [Chrome App GCM Sample] and uses the recommended way to create a Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: The sample below is based on [Chrome App GCM Sample] and uses the recommended way to create a Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: In the sections below, we will highlight the steps related to Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: In the sections below, we will highlight the steps related to Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you download the source for this Chrome App from [Chrome App Notification Hub Sample].
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you download the source for this Chrome App from [Chrome App Notification Hub Sample].

trans-unit.source: The Chrome App is created via JavaScript, and you can use any of your preferred word editors for creating it.
trans-unit.target: The Chrome App is created via JavaScript, and you can use any of your preferred word editors for creating it.

trans-unit.source: Below is what this Chrome App will look like.
trans-unit.target: Below is what this Chrome App will look like.

trans-unit.source: Create a folder and name it **ChromePushApp** or anything that you want.
trans-unit.target: Create a folder and name it **ChromePushApp** or anything that you want.

trans-unit.source: Download **cryto-js library** from [crypto-js library] in this folder.
trans-unit.target: Download **cryto-js library** from [crypto-js library] in this folder.

trans-unit.source: This library folder will contain two subfolders: **components** and **rollups**.
trans-unit.target: This library folder will contain two subfolders: **components** and **rollups**.

trans-unit.source: Create a **manifest.json** file.
trans-unit.target: Create a **manifest.json** file.

trans-unit.source: All Chrome Apps are backed by a manifest file that describes the app metadata and, in particular, the permissions that are available to the app.
trans-unit.target: All Chrome Apps are backed by a manifest file that describes the app metadata and, in particular, the permissions that are available to the app.

trans-unit.source: Note the **permissions** element, which specifies that this Chrome App be able to receive push notifications from GCM.
trans-unit.target: Note the **permissions** element, which specifies that this Chrome App be able to receive push notifications from GCM.

trans-unit.source: It must also specify the Azure Notification Hubs URI where the Chrome App will make a REST call to register.
trans-unit.target: It must also specify the Azure Notification Hubs URI where the Chrome App will make a REST call to register.

trans-unit.source: This uses an icon file, gcm_128.png, that you will find at the source that's reused from the original GCM sample.
trans-unit.target: This uses an icon file, gcm_128.png, that you will find at the source that's reused from the original GCM sample.

trans-unit.source: You can use any image that you want.
trans-unit.target: You can use any image that you want.

trans-unit.source: Create a file called **background.js** with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Create a file called **background.js** with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This is the file that pops up the Chrome App window HTML (**register.html**) and also defines the handler **messageReceived** to handle the incoming push notification.
trans-unit.target: This is the file that pops up the Chrome App window HTML (**register.html**) and also defines the handler **messageReceived** to handle the incoming push notification.

trans-unit.source: Create a file called **register.html** that defines the UI of the Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: Create a file called **register.html** that defines the UI of the Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: Note that this sample uses *CryptoJS v3.1.2*.
trans-unit.target: Note that this sample uses *CryptoJS v3.1.2*.

trans-unit.source: If you downloaded any other version, then fix the script src path.
trans-unit.target: If you downloaded any other version, then fix the script src path.

trans-unit.source: Create a file called **register.js** with the code below.
trans-unit.target: Create a file called **register.js** with the code below.

trans-unit.source: This file specifies the script behind **register.html**.
trans-unit.target: This file specifies the script behind **register.html**.

trans-unit.source: Chrome Apps do not allow inline execution, so you have to create a separate backing script for your UI.
trans-unit.target: Chrome Apps do not allow inline execution, so you have to create a separate backing script for your UI.

trans-unit.source: The above script has the following takeaways:
trans-unit.target: The above script has the following takeaways:

trans-unit.source: *window.onload* defines the button-click events of the two buttons on the UI.
trans-unit.target: *window.onload* defines the button-click events of the two buttons on the UI.

trans-unit.source: One registers with GCM, and the other uses the registration ID that's returned after registration with GCM to register with Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: One registers with GCM, and the other uses the registration ID that's returned after registration with GCM to register with Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: *updateLog* is the function that defines a simple logging function.
trans-unit.target: *updateLog* is the function that defines a simple logging function.

trans-unit.source: *registerWithGCM* is the first button-click handler, which makes the **chrome.gcm.register** call to GCM to register this Chrome App instance.
trans-unit.target: *registerWithGCM* is the first button-click handler, which makes the **chrome.gcm.register** call to GCM to register this Chrome App instance.

trans-unit.source: *registerCallback* is the callback function that gets called when the above GCM registration call returns.
trans-unit.target: *registerCallback* is the callback function that gets called when the above GCM registration call returns.

trans-unit.source: *registerWithNH* is the second button-click handler, which registers with Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: *registerWithNH* is the second button-click handler, which registers with Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: It gets **hubName** and **connectionString** (which the user has specified) and crafts the Notification Hubs Registration REST API call.
trans-unit.target: It gets **hubName** and **connectionString** (which the user has specified) and crafts the Notification Hubs Registration REST API call.

trans-unit.source: *splitConnectionString* and *generateSaSToken* are a JavaScript implementation of creating a SaS token that must be sent in all REST API calls.
trans-unit.target: *splitConnectionString* and *generateSaSToken* are a JavaScript implementation of creating a SaS token that must be sent in all REST API calls.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Common Concepts](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn495627.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Common Concepts](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn495627.aspx).

trans-unit.source: *sendNHRegistrationRequest* is the function that makes an HTTP REST call.
trans-unit.target: *sendNHRegistrationRequest* is the function that makes an HTTP REST call.

trans-unit.source: *registrationPayload* defines the registration XML payload.
trans-unit.target: *registrationPayload* defines the registration XML payload.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Create Registration NH REST API].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Create Registration NH REST API].

trans-unit.source: We update the registration ID in it with what we received from GCM.
trans-unit.target: We update the registration ID in it with what we received from GCM.

trans-unit.source: *client* is an instance of **XMLHttpRequest** that we use to make the HTTP POST request.
trans-unit.target: *client* is an instance of **XMLHttpRequest** that we use to make the HTTP POST request.

trans-unit.source: Note that we update the **Authorization** header with **sasToken**.
trans-unit.target: Note that we update the **Authorization** header with **sasToken**.

trans-unit.source: Successful completion of this call will register this Chrome App instance with Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: Successful completion of this call will register this Chrome App instance with Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following view for your folder at the end of this:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following view for your folder at the end of this:

trans-unit.source: Set up and test your Chrome App
trans-unit.target: Set up and test your Chrome App

trans-unit.source: Open your Chrome browser.
trans-unit.target: Open your Chrome browser.

trans-unit.source: Open **Chrome extensions** and enable **Developer mode**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Chrome extensions** and enable **Developer mode**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Load unpacked extension** and navigate to the folder where you created the files.
trans-unit.target: Click **Load unpacked extension** and navigate to the folder where you created the files.

trans-unit.source: You can also optionally use the **Chrome Apps & Extensions Developer Tool**.
trans-unit.target: You can also optionally use the **Chrome Apps & Extensions Developer Tool**.

trans-unit.source: This tool is a Chrome App in itself (installed from the Chrome Web Store) and provides advanced debugging capabilities for your Chrome App development.
trans-unit.target: This tool is a Chrome App in itself (installed from the Chrome Web Store) and provides advanced debugging capabilities for your Chrome App development.

trans-unit.source: If the Chrome App is created without any errors, then you will see your Chrome App show up.
trans-unit.target: If the Chrome App is created without any errors, then you will see your Chrome App show up.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **Project Number** that you got earlier from the **Google Cloud Console** as the sender ID, and click **Register with GCM**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **Project Number** that you got earlier from the **Google Cloud Console** as the sender ID, and click **Register with GCM**.

trans-unit.source: You must see the message **Registration with GCM succeeded.**
trans-unit.target: You must see the message **Registration with GCM succeeded.**

trans-unit.source: Enter your **Notification Hub Name** and the **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained from the Azure portal earlier, and click **Register with Azure Notification Hub**.
trans-unit.target: Enter your **Notification Hub Name** and the **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained from the Azure portal earlier, and click **Register with Azure Notification Hub**.

trans-unit.source: You must see the message **Notification Hub Registration successful!** and the details of the registration response, which contains the Azure Notification Hubs registration ID.
trans-unit.target: You must see the message **Notification Hub Registration successful!** and the details of the registration response, which contains the Azure Notification Hubs registration ID.

trans-unit.source: Send a notification to your Chrome App
trans-unit.target: Send a notification to your Chrome App

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.

trans-unit.source: However, you can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the REST interface.
trans-unit.target: However, you can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the REST interface.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" ([.NET backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-android-get-started-push.md) | [JavaScript backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-android-get-started-push.md)).
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" ([.NET backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-android-get-started-push.md) | [JavaScript backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-android-get-started-push.md)).

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP/Python" ([Java](notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md) | [PHP](notification-hubs-php-backend-how-to.md) | [Python](notification-hubs-python-backend-how-to.md)).
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP/Python" ([Java](notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md) | [PHP](notification-hubs-php-backend-how-to.md) | [Python](notification-hubs-python-backend-how-to.md)).

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, from the **File** menu, select **New** and then **Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, from the **File** menu, select **New** and then **Project**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Visual C#**, click **Windows** and **Console Application**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Visual C#**, click **Windows** and **Console Application**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new console application project.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new console application project.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Library Package Manager** and then **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Library Package Manager** and then **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: In the console window, execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: In the console window, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK with the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK with the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Open the file **Program.cs** and add the following `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the file **Program.cs** and add the following `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: In the **Program** class, add the following method:
trans-unit.target: In the **Program** class, add the following method:

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the *hub name* placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the **Notification Hubs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the *hub name* placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the **Notification Hubs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."
trans-unit.target: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure that you use the connection string with **Full** access, not **Listen** access.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure that you use the connection string with **Full** access, not **Listen** access.

trans-unit.source: The **Listen** access string does not have permissions to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: The **Listen** access string does not have permissions to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Add the following lines in the **Main** method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following lines in the **Main** method:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that your Chrome browser is open.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that your Chrome browser is open.

trans-unit.source: Your Chrome App doesn't need to be opened for this.
trans-unit.target: Your Chrome App doesn't need to be opened for this.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following notification pop up on your desktop.
trans-unit.target: You should see the following notification pop up on your desktop.

trans-unit.source: You can also see all your notifications by using the Chrome Notifications window on the taskbar (in Windows) when Chrome is running.
trans-unit.target: You can also see all your notifications by using the Chrome Notifications window on the taskbar (in Windows) when Chrome is running.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to your Chrome App.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to your Chrome App.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Overview].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Overview].

trans-unit.source: To target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users].
trans-unit.target: To target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Azure Notification Hubs breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Azure Notification Hubs breaking news].
